taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus anaplobatus;species parviflorus;

treatment.description: Similar to no. 5, more or less glandular, but stems scarcely bristly; lobes of leaves ovate, coarsely toothed; peduncles 1-15-flowered; calyx-lobes canescent-pilose or villous, rarely with short pale glands; petals white; fruit juicy and of rich flavor, (Rubacer Rydb.)
treatment.discussion: Polymorphic species, highly variable in degree of pubescence and glandularity.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Thickets and borders of woods, Bruce Pen., Ont., to Minn.; Black Hills, S.D.; Alta. and s. Alaska, s. to mts. of Mex., Ariz. and Calif. Fl. June, July; fr. Aug., Sept.
